intro: Balinotella seseloides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sesel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Native to the western United States, it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Its aromatic foliage and delicate flowers make it a distinctive addition to native plant gardens.
